metadata.name: Samaveda #1/10
metadata.description:
3D Object - Turn, Move and Zoom the Frame.

Hindus consider the Vedas to be "apauruṣeya", which means "not of a man, superhuman", revelations of sacred sounds and texts heard by ancient sages after intense meditation.

Samaveda is the Veda of melodies and chants. It is an ancient Vedic Sanskrit text, and part of the scriptures of Hinduism. One of the four Vedas, it is a liturgical text which consists of 1,875 verses.

The Samaveda frame was specifically designed for [Archan Nair's](https://superrare.com/archannair) artworks [Chryseis](https://opensea.io/collection/chryseis) and Prana. Like Chryseis, Samaveda #1/10 is a 10/10 edition. It gives Chryseis space, but also boundaries while allowing it to live. It pays tribute to Archans’ brilliant art, cultural heritage, and the frame as a unique piece of art.

Experience Samaveda #1/10 in our [3D Gallery](https://frahm.generativeartist.com/campaigns/archan/?preset=12&campaignLogo=/campaigns/archan/1_Chryseis.png).

Please note: Frahm is about frames. Frame NFTs represent the frame only and do not include the NFT being displayed inside of it. Holders of frame NFTs can use our [platform](https://frahm.art/) to display their NFTs inside the frames.
